title: Ticket #3003: cgroup reuse does not reset accounting statistics
description:
We recently changed the cgroups implementation (#2734) to increase the likelihood of cgroup reuse (we now name the cgroup after the slot, not after the job running in it). This way, if a starter doesn't clean things up correctly, the job likely will reuse the cgroup (and hopefully clean it up properly afterward!).

As an unfortunate side-effect, activity from the previous job (such as CPU usage, max memory usage) will be added to the subsequent job. If job 1 has 20 seconds of user CPU and job 2 has 1 second of user CPU (and reuses job 1's cgroup), the procd will report 21 seconds of user CPU for job 2.

We need to reset statistics for:

  • CPU usage.
  • Max memory usage. Note: I've come to the conclusion that the max memory usage statistics the kernel keeps is useless for us, as it includes filesystem cache. Ouch.
  • Block I/O.

#2734 isn't in any current release, so we should do this before 7.9.0.
